result.execSummary:
The defendant Adolfo C. Hernandez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Adolfo C. Hernandez is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Adolfo C. Hernandez was found guilty of Possession of THC [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

supervisions.notes:
Credit for 3 days, if revoked.
Court will allow probation to transfer to the state of Illinois if approved by DOC.
Any violation of probation shall be reported to the Court w/n 30 days and at least 30 days prior to the termination of the DE's probation.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent. Pay supervision fees. Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence. Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores. Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription. Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine. Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent. Counseling shall specifically include: AODA Assessment and follow through with recommended treatment. Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program. 
* Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges. 
* If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered. 
* Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court.
***Court will allow probation to transfer to the State of Illinois. 
May not have contact with Sebastian Castaneda, Angel Gomez, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent. May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Any violation of probation shall be reported to the Court w/n 30 days and at least 30 days prior to the termination of DE's probation.

defendant.name: Hernandez, Adolfo C.

records.addlTxt: of DNA Collection at Conviction
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

10:35 AM Attorney Daniel Joseph Tombasco in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Adolfo C. Hernandez in court.  Attorney Terry William Rose in court for Adolfo C. Hernandez. Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: The State verbally amends count 2 to Wis. stat. 961.41(3g)(e) Possession of THC on the record. Defendant entered a plea of guilty to amended count 2; found guilty by the court. On State's motion, counts 1 & 3 are dismissed. Court orders withheld sentence; defendant placed on probation for 1 year w/conditions. No contact with Sebastian C. or Angel G.. Any violation of probation shall be reported to the Court within 30 days and at least 30 days prior to the termination of the DE's probation. Court will allow probation to transfer to the state of Illinois if approved by DOC. 3 days sentence credit if revoked.  Court costs, Drug surcharge and DNA surcharge ordered.  Defendant is ordered to submit a DNA sample and pay the cost; written notice provided to defendant. Appeals rights given.
Scheduling Order

State appears by Attorney Alexandra Smathers. Attorney Terry William Rose in court with Defendant Adolfo C. Hernandez.  Clerk: PU
   Minutes:  Sworn in and testified is State's witness:  PPPD Officer S. Anguiano; cross-examination by Atty Rose. State rests and moves for bind over; arguments heard. Probable cause found; bound over for trial. Information filed; reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Scheduling Order given to Attorney in court.   Bond continued.  Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.

01:07 PM    Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Terry Rose.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 20 days; Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 09:30 am. before Commissioner.   Cash bond posted and continued w/ same conditions (see previous bond entry). rb
Submitted by Atty Terry Rose
Submitted by Atty Terry Rose
Atty Terry Rose
from the Court re: judicial rotation 8/1/22 mailed to DE
Adjourned initial appearance on August 4, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

244PM    Assistant District Attorney Sydney Star appeared for the State.   Defendant appeared in court in person.  Clerk JT  Minutes: Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 01:00 pm. Attorney Status. Cash bond posted and continued as previously set.  DE waives time for the preliminary hearing. DE has re-applied for SPD. rb
Status conference on June 16, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant, Adolfo C. Hernandez, appeared.  Intern Daniel Bernard Deida with Attorney Carli A. McNeill appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE is not eligible for SPD and is given advocate counsel paperwork today.   DE waives time for the preliminary hearing.  Bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
